00010 // Check against redundant including
00011 #ifndef TT_DELAY_H

00014 // Include appropriate headers

00017 /********************************************************
00018         CLASS INTERFACE/IMPLEMENTATION
00019 
00020         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00021  ********************************************************/
00022 
00023 class tt_delay:public tt_audio_base{
00024 
00025         private:
00026                 // Function pointers for the DSP Loops (use this instead of branching for speed)
00027                 typedef void (tt_delay::*function_ptr_1in_1out)(tt_audio_signal *, tt_audio_signal *);
00028                 typedef void (tt_delay::*function_ptr_2in_1out)(tt_audio_signal *, tt_audio_signal *, tt_audio_signal *);
00029                 function_ptr_1in_1out           dsp_executor;
00030                 function_ptr_2in_1out           dsp_executor2;
00031 
00032                 // ATTRIBUTES & VARIABLES
00033                 tt_attribute_value                              delay_ms;                       // in milliseconds
00034                 tt_attribute_value                              delay_ms_max;
00035                 tt_attribute_value_discrete             delay_samples;
00036                 tt_attribute_value_discrete             delay_samples_max;
00037                 tt_attribute_value_discrete             interpolation;
00038                 double                                                  fractional_delay;       // used in interpolated dsp loops
00039                 double                                                  fdelay_samples;
00040 
00041                 tt_sample_vector                                buffer;
00042                 tt_sample_vector                                in_ptr;                         // "write" pointer for buffer
00043                 tt_sample_vector                                out_ptr;                        // "read" pointer
00044                 tt_sample_vector                                end_ptr;                        // points to last sample in buffer (for speed)
00045 
00046                 tt_sample_value                                 output[4];              
00047         
00048         public:
00049                 enum selectors{                                                                         // Attribute Selectors
00050                         k_delay_ms,
00051                         k_delay_samples,
00052                         k_interpolation,
00053                                 k_interpolation_none,
00054                                 k_interpolation_linear,
00055                                 k_interpolation_linear2,
00056                                 k_interpolation_polynomial,
00057                                 k_interpolation_polynomial2,
00058                 };
00059                 
00060 
00061                 // OBJECT LIFE                                  
00062                 tt_delay(long max)                                              // Constructor - INT ARGUMENT: SPECIFY IN SAMPLES
00063                 {
00064                         init(max);
00065                 }
00066 
00067                 tt_delay(float max_ms)                                  // Constructor - FLOAT ARGUMENT: SPECIFY IN MS
00068                 {
00069                         long max = long(max_ms * m_sr);
00070                         init(max);
00071                 }
00072 
00073                 // Internal method which is called by the constructors
00074                 void init(long max_samples)
00075                 {                       
00076                         short i;
00077                         
00078                         buffer = in_ptr = out_ptr = end_ptr = 0;
00079                         output[0] = output[1] = output[2] = output[3] = 0;              
00080                 
00081                         mem_free(buffer);
00082                         buffer = (tt_sample_value *)mem_alloc((max_samples + 4) * sizeof(tt_sample_value));
00083                         
00084                         in_ptr = buffer;
00085                         delay_samples_max = max_samples;
00086                         delay_ms_max = delay_samples_max / m_sr;
00087                         //post("INIT: delay_ms_max: %f    delay_samps_max: %i", delay_ms_max, delay_samples_max);                       
00088                         set_attr(k_delay_samples, max_samples - 1);
00089                         set_attr(k_interpolation, k_interpolation_linear);
00090                         for(i=0;i<4;i++)
00091                                 output[i] = 0;
00092                                         
00093                         reset();
00094                 }
00095 
00096 
00097                 ~tt_delay()                                                                             // Destructor
00098                 {
00099                         mem_free(buffer);
00100                 }
00101                 
00102                 
00103                 // OVER-RIDE THE INHERITED SET SR METHOD
00104                 void set_sr(int value)
00105                 {
00106                         if(value != sr){
00107                                 sr = value;                                     // These first three need to be called to do the standard stuff from the base class
00108                                 r_sr = 1.0 / value;                     //      THERE SHOULD BE A MORE ELEGANT WAY OF DOING THIS, NO ?!?!?!?!?
00109                                 m_sr = (float)sr * 0.001;       //              ...
00110                         
00111                                 // This is the SR setting stuff that is specific to this object.
00112 //                              if((m_sr * delay_ms) > delay_samples_max)
00113                                         init(long(m_sr * delay_ms));    // allocate a larger delay buffer if neccessary
00114                                 set_attr(k_delay_ms, delay_ms);         // hold the delay_length in ms constant, despite the change of sr
00115                         }
00116                 }
00117 
00118 
00119                 // ATTRIBUTES
00120                 void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value val)  // Set Attributes
00121                 {
00122                         switch (sel){
00123                                 case k_delay_ms:
00124                                         delay_ms = val;
00125                                         //delay_samples = clip(long(delay_ms * m_sr), long(0), delay_samples_max);
00126                                         fdelay_samples = delay_ms * m_sr;
00127                                         delay_samples = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)fdelay_samples;
00128                                         fractional_delay = fdelay_samples - delay_samples;
00129                                         
00130                                         break;
00131                                 case k_delay_samples:
00132                                         fdelay_samples = delay_samples = clip(long(val), long(0), delay_samples_max);
00133                                         delay_ms = (float)delay_samples * 1000.0 / (float)sr;
00134                                         fractional_delay = 0;
00135                                         break;
00136                                 case k_interpolation:
00137                                         interpolation = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)val;
00138                                         if(interpolation == k_interpolation_linear){
00139                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_linear;
00140                                                 dsp_executor2 = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_linear_2in;
00141                                         }       
00142                                         else if(interpolation == k_interpolation_none){
00143                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_nointerp;
00144                                                 dsp_executor2 = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_nointerp_2in;
00145                                         }
00146                                         else if(interpolation == k_interpolation_polynomial){
00147                                                 dsp_executor = 0;
00148                                                 dsp_executor2 = 0;
00149                                                 // dsp_executor2 = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_poly_2in;
00150                                                 log_post("tt_delay: This interpolation mode is not currently functional");
00151                                         }
00152                                         else if(interpolation == k_interpolation_polynomial2){
00153                                                 dsp_executor = 0;
00154                                                 // dsp_executor2 = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_poly2_2in;
00155                                         }
00156                                         else if(interpolation == k_interpolation_linear2){
00157                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_linear;
00158                                                 // dsp_executor2 = &tt_delay::dsp_vector_calc_linear2_2in;
00159                                         }       
00160                                         else
00161                                                 log_error("tt_delay: invalid interpolation mode specified");
00162                                         break;
00163                                 default:
00164                                         log_error("tt_delay: invalid attribute specified for set_attr()");
00165                                         break;
00166                         }
00167                         reset();
00168                 }
00169 
00170                 tt_attribute_value get_attr(tt_selector sel)                            // Get Attributes
00171                 {
00172                         switch (sel){
00173                                 case k_delay_ms:
00174                                         return delay_ms;
00175                                 case k_delay_samples:
00176                                         return tt_attribute_value(delay_samples);
00177                                 case k_interpolation:
00178                                         return interpolation;
00179                                 default:
00180                                         log_error("tt_delay: invalid attribute specified for get_attr()");                              
00181                                         return 0.0;
00182                         }
00183                 }

00187                 /*****************************************************
00188                  * DSP LOOPS
00189                  *****************************************************/
00190                 
00191                 // Publically exposed interface for CONTROL RATE triggered dsp routine
00192                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00193                 {
00194                         (*this.*dsp_executor)(in, out); // Run the function pointed to by our function pointer
00195                 }
00196         
00197                 // Publically exposed interface for AUDIO RATE delay dsp routine
00198                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in1, tt_audio_signal *in2, tt_audio_signal *out)
00199                 {
00200                         (*this.*dsp_executor2)(in1, in2, out);  // Run the function pointed to by our function pointer
00201                 }
00202 
00203         private:
00204                 // DSP LOOP - NO INTERPOLATION
00205                 void dsp_vector_calc_nointerp(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00206                 {
00207                         temp_vs = in->vectorsize;
00208                     while(temp_vs--){
00209                                 *in_ptr++ = *in->vector++;              // Store Input
00210                                 *out->vector++ = *out_ptr++;    // Find Output
00211                                 
00212                                 if(in_ptr > end_ptr)    // Buffer Managment...
00213                                         in_ptr = buffer;
00214                                 if(out_ptr > end_ptr)
00215                                         out_ptr = buffer;       
00216                     }
00217                     in->reset(); out->reset();
00218                 }
00219 
00220                 // DSP LOOP - NO INTERPOLATION - SIGNAL SPEC'D DELAY TIME
00221                 void dsp_vector_calc_nointerp_2in(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *in2, tt_audio_signal *out)
00222                 {
00223                         temp_vs = in->vectorsize;
00224 
00225                         // CALCULATE THE DELAY TIME
00226                         delay_ms = *in2->vector;                // Because this is the Lo-Fi loop, just do this at the vector...
00227                         fdelay_samples = delay_ms * m_sr;
00228                         delay_samples = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)fdelay_samples;
00229                         fractional_delay = fdelay_samples - delay_samples;
00230 
00231                     while(temp_vs--){
00232                                 *in_ptr++ = *in->vector++;              // Store Input
00233                                 *out->vector++ = *out_ptr++;    // Find Output
00234                                 
00235                                 if(in_ptr > end_ptr)    // Buffer Managment...
00236                                         in_ptr = buffer;
00237                                 if(out_ptr > end_ptr)
00238                                         out_ptr = buffer;       
00239                     }
00240                     in->reset(); in2->reset(); out->reset();
00241                 }
00242 
00243 
00244                 // DSP LOOP - LINEAR INTERPOLATION
00245                 void dsp_vector_calc_linear(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00246                 {
00247                         float temp;
00248                         tt_sample_value *next;
00249                         
00250                         temp_vs = in->vectorsize;
00251                     while(temp_vs--){
00252                                 *in_ptr = *in->vector++;                // Store Input
00253                                                                 
00254                                 // MOVE THE RECORD HEAD
00255                                 in_ptr++;
00256                                 if(in_ptr > end_ptr)
00257                                         in_ptr = buffer;
00258 
00259                                 // MOVE THE PLAY HEAD
00260                                 out_ptr++;                              
00261                                 if(out_ptr > end_ptr)   
00262                                         out_ptr = buffer;
00263 
00264                                 // STORE THE VALUE OF THE NEXT SAMPLE IN THE BUFFER FOR INTERPOLATION
00265                                 next = out_ptr + 1;
00266                                 if(next > end_ptr)
00267                                         next = buffer + (next - end_ptr);
00268                                 else if(next < buffer)
00269                                         next = end_ptr + (next - buffer) + 1;
00270                                 temp = *next;
00271 
00272                                         
00273                                 // Interpolate between the play head value (from above) and the next play head value
00274                                 *out->vector++ = (temp * (1.0 - fractional_delay)) + (*out_ptr * fractional_delay);
00275                     }
00276                     in->reset(); out->reset();
00277                 }
00278 
00279 
00280                 // DSP LOOP - DELAY TIME IS A SIGNAL (LINEAR INTERPOLATION)
00281                 // Note: A modulated delay is essentially a resampling process. This means that when we resample we need the 
00282                 //      values that are "between" the buffer indices - thus we interpolate to find them (not between output indices).
00283                 void dsp_vector_calc_linear_2in(tt_audio_signal *in1, tt_audio_signal *in2, tt_audio_signal *out)
00284                 {
00285                         tt_sample_value temp;
00286                         tt_sample_value *next;
00287                         
00288                         if(buffer == NULL)
00289                                 return;
00290                         
00291                         temp_vs = in1->vectorsize;
00292                     while(temp_vs--){
00293                                 *in_ptr = *in1->vector++;               // Store the audio input @ the record head
00294                                 delay_ms = *in2->vector++;              // Store the delay time input
00295 //                              delay_ms = clip(*in2->vector++, 0.f, delay_ms_max);             // Store the delay time input
00296                                 
00297                                 // CALCULATE THE DELAY TIME
00298                                 // delay_samples = clip(long(delay_ms * m_sr), long(0), delay_samples_max);
00299 //                              delay_samples = delay_ms * m_sr;
00300                                 fdelay_samples = delay_ms * m_sr;
00301                                 delay_samples = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)fdelay_samples;
00302                                 fractional_delay = fdelay_samples - delay_samples;
00303 
00304 //                              end_ptr = buffer + delay_samples;                                       // set pointer to the end of the buffer
00305 
00306                                 // MOVE THE RECORD HEAD
00307                                 in_ptr++;
00308                                 if(in_ptr > end_ptr)
00309                                         in_ptr = buffer;
00310 //                              *in_ptr = *in1->vector++;               // Store the audio input @ the record head
00311                                         
00312                                 // MOVE THE PLAY HEAD
00313                                 out_ptr = in_ptr - delay_samples;
00314                                 if(out_ptr > end_ptr)
00315                                         out_ptr = buffer + (out_ptr - end_ptr);
00316                                 else if(out_ptr < buffer)
00317                                         out_ptr = end_ptr + (out_ptr - buffer) + 1;
00318 
00319                                 // STORE THE VALUE OF THE NEXT SAMPLE IN THE BUFFER FOR INTERPOLATION
00320                                 next = out_ptr + 1;
00321                                 if(next > end_ptr)
00322                                         next = buffer + (next - end_ptr);
00323                                 else if(next < buffer)
00324                                         next = end_ptr + (next - buffer) + 1;
00325                                 temp = *next;
00326                                 
00327                                 // Interpolate between the play head value (from above) and the next value in the buffer
00328                                 *out->vector++ = (temp * (1.0 - fractional_delay)) + (*out_ptr * fractional_delay);
00329                     }
00330                     in1->reset(); in2->reset(); out->reset();
00331                         //log_post("delay_signal_ms: %f, samples: %f (%i)", delay_ms, fdelay_samples, delay_samples);
00332                 }

00337                 {
00338                         //sample_value temp;
00339                         double fdelay_samples;
00340                         short i;
00341                         
00342                         temp_vs = in1->vectorsize;
00343                     while(temp_vs--){
00344                                 *in_ptr = *in1->vector++;               // Store the Audio Input                        
00345                                 delay_ms = *in2->vector++;              // Store the Delay Time Input
00346                                 
00347                                 // MOVE THE RECORD HEAD
00348                                 in_ptr++;
00349                                 if(in_ptr > end_ptr)
00350                                         in_ptr = buffer;
00351 
00352                                 // CALCULATE THE DELAY TIME
00353                                 fdelay_samples = delay_ms * m_sr;
00354                                 delay_samples = fdelay_samples;
00355                                 fractional_delay = fdelay_samples - delay_samples;
00356 
00357                                 // STORE THE PLAY HEAD VALUE
00358                                 //temp = *out_ptr;
00359                                         
00360                                 // MOVE THE PLAY HEAD

00362                                 if(out_ptr > end_ptr)
00363                                         out_ptr = buffer + (out_ptr - end_ptr);
00364                                 else if(out_ptr < buffer)
00365                                         out_ptr = end_ptr + (out_ptr - buffer) + 1;
00366                                 
00367                                 
00368                                 
00369                                 // shift the past outputs
00370                                 for(i=0; i<3; i++)
00371                                         output[i] = output[i+1];
00372                                 // store the latest resolved sample
00373                                 output[3] = *out_ptr;   
00374                                 
00375                                 // Interpolate between the play head value (from above) and the next play head value
00376                                 // *out++ = (temp * (1.0 - fractional_delay)) + (*out_ptr * fractional_delay);
00377                                 *out->vector++ = interpolation_polynomial(output[0], output[1], output[2], output[3]);
00378                     }

00381                 
00382 
00383                 // polynomial interpolation
00384                 // taken straight from Hal Chamberlin, page 517
00385                 tt_sample_value interpolation_polynomial(tt_sample_value y0, tt_sample_value y1, tt_sample_value y2, tt_sample_value y3)
00386                 {
00387                         tt_sample_value yu;
00388                         float   x0 = fractional_delay - 1;
00389                         float   x1 = x1 -1;
00390                         float   xu = 0;
00391                         float   x2 = fractional_delay;
00392                         float   x3 = fractional_delay + 1;
00393                         
00394                         yu =  -0.1666667 * y0 * ((xu - x1) * (xu - x2) * (xu - x3))
00395                                  + 0.5           * y1 * ((xu - x0) * (xu - x2) * (xu - x3))
00396                                  - 0.5           * y2 * ((xu - x0) * (xu - x1) * (xu - x3))
00397                                  + 0.1666667 * y3 * ((xu - x0) * (xu - x1) * (xu - x2));
00398                         
00399                         return(yu);
00400                 }
00401 */              
00402                 
00403                 
00404                 // Reset the pointers
00405                 void reset()
00406                 {
00407                         end_ptr = buffer + delay_samples;
00408                         out_ptr = in_ptr - delay_samples;
00409                         if(out_ptr < buffer)
00410                                 out_ptr = end_ptr + (out_ptr - buffer) + 1;
00411                         else if(out_ptr > end_ptr)
00412                                 out_ptr = buffer + (out_ptr - end_ptr);
00413                                 
00414                         clear();
00415                 }
00416                 
00417                 
00418         public: 
00419                 // clear
00420                 void clear(void)
00421                 {
00422                         float * i;
00423                         long j = 0;
00424                                                 
00425                         for(i = buffer; i< end_ptr; i++, j++)
00426                                 //buffer[i] = 0.0;
00427                                 buffer[j] = 0.0;
00428                                 //*(buffer+i) = 0.0;
00429                 }
